title: Russian media, all state-controlled, offers only muted coverage of the retreat from Kherson.
dc:creator: Neil MacFarquhar

media:content.media:credit: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Roman Kostenko, a Ukrainian colonel and parliamentarian, checks for mines as he and his detail make their way into the village of Snihurivka along the Kherson front in southern Ukraine on Thursday.
